arts.ttl: Scottish Premiership: Celtic close gap after Hearts held by Dundee United
arts.sum: Tierney strikes as Celtic defeat Kilmarnock 4-0 Rangers beat Dundee for third straight league win Kieran Tierney scored his first Celtic goal in seven years as the Premiership champions cut the gap on leaders Hearts to seven points with a 4-0 home victory against Kilmarnock. The left-back, who scored on his final Arsenal appearance in May, drilled in from 25 yards to double Celtic’s lead six minutes into the second half. It was the 28-year-old’s first Celtic goal since a Europa League win against RB Leipzig on 8 November 2018. Johnny Kenny had opened the scoring in the 10th minute with his fourth goal in four matches under the interim management team of Martin O’Neill and Shaun Maloney. Daizen Maeda missed several good chances for Celtic and Kilmarnock hit the crossbar through Bruce Anderson before Tierney struck. The home side struggled to build on the cushion but late goals from Maeda and Arne Engels, from the spot, added a flattering sheen to the scoreline. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: League leaders Hearts drop points in draw at Dundee United
arts.sum: Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts were held to a 1-1 draw at home to Dundee United thanks to a Luca Stephenson equaliser just before half-time for the visitors.

Top of the table hosts top of the bottom six, heading into the weekend's fixtures, as Hearts and Dundee United go toe-to-toe at Tynecastle in one of four Scottish Premiership matches on Sunday afterno...

arts.ttl: Jim Goodwin challenges Dundee United to make amends and torpedo Hearts unbeaten Premiership run
arts.sum: Dundee United narrowly missed out in a five goal thriller at Tannadice and are out to make amends

arts.ttl: All 6 Scottish Premiership weekend predictions - Week 12
arts.sum: After last week's Scottish League Cup action, all 12 teams are back in action in the Scottish Premiership this week and Tom Hill has made a prediction for every match.
